meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of Austria, Germany, and Switzerland.
meanings.sent1: In the past, a schilling could buy many things.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather showed me an old schilling from Austria.
meanings.sent3: Why did the old coin go to school? To become a schilling!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny schilling, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the schilling hitting the counter echoed through the store.

meanings.definition: A coin formerly used in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland.
meanings.sent1: The antique shop had a collection of old schillings on display.
meanings.sent2: I found a rare schilling in my great-grandmother's jewelry box.
meanings.sent3: Why did the coin feel lonely? It wanted to be a schilling!
meanings.sent4: His laughter rang out like a handful of jingling schillings.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the schilling caught her eye as it rolled across the floor.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in various countries, including Austria and Germany.
meanings.sent1: The exchange rate for the schilling was favorable for travelers.
meanings.sent2: Shops in Vienna still accept schillings as a form of payment.
meanings.sent3: Why did the dollar feel jealous of the schilling? It had more cents!
meanings.sent4: Her words carried the weight of a thousand schillings, valuable and impactful.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banknotes of the schilling brightened up the cashier's drawer.
